clusters.title: How did Bodø/Glimt beat Inter? #sports

items.title: How did Bodø/Glimt beat Inter? #sports
items.standfirst: A small town side rewrites the script A club from Norway’s far north completed one of the season’s most startling European upsets by eliminating Inter Milan from the Champions League playoff. The victory capped a run in which the Norwegian outfit had already taken scalps on the continent,…
items.content: A small town side rewrites the script A club from Norway’s far north completed one of the season’s most startling European upsets by eliminating Inter Milan from the Champions League playoff. The victory capped a run in which the Norwegian outfit had already taken scalps on the continent,…

items.title: Bodo/Glimt knock out Inter Milan, continue fairytale Champions League run
items.standfirst: The Norwegian team of no stars with a tiny budget have moved onto the last 16 of the world's biggest club competition.
items.content: The Norwegian team of no stars with a tiny budget have moved onto the last 16 of the world's biggest club competition.

items.title: Champions League: Bodo/Glimt make history by eliminating Inter Milan
items.standfirst: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt made history by knocking 2025 finalist Inter Milan out of the Champions League on Tuesday (2-1).
items.content: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt made history by knocking 2025 finalist Inter Milan out of the Champions League on Tuesday (2-1).

items.title: 'Historical moment' as Bodo/Glimt succeed against all odds
items.standfirst: Bodo/Glimt knock out last year's finalists Inter Milan in one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history and now the team from the Arctic Circle is dreaming of how far they can go after reaching last 16.
items.content: Bodo/Glimt knock out last year's finalists Inter Milan in one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history and now the team from the Arctic Circle is dreaming of how far they can go after reaching last 16.

clusters.title: Trump honors gold medal-winning men's hockey team at State of the Union amid controversy

items.title: Trump honors gold medal-winning men's hockey team at State of the Union amid controversy
items.standfirst: The celebration of the men's team comes after FBI Director Kash Patel's trip to the Games in Milan, and the president's comments about the U.S. women's team, have drawn scrutiny.
items.content: The celebration of the men's team comes after FBI Director Kash Patel's trip to the Games in Milan, and the president's comments about the U.S. women's team, have drawn scrutiny.(Image credit: Kenny Holston)

items.title: Gold medal-winning men's hockey team honored at State of the Union
items.standfirst: The U.S. men's hockey team also visited the White House on Tuesday following their gold medal win at the Winter Olympics.
items.content: The U.S. men's hockey team also visited the White House on Tuesday following their gold medal win at the Winter Olympics.

items.title: FBI head Kash Patel celebrates with men's hockey team amid major probes in U.S.
items.standfirst: FBI Director Kash Patel chugged beer and sprayed it over members of the American men’s hockey team following their gold medal win in Italy on Sunday.
items.content: FBI Director Kash Patel chugged beer and sprayed it over members of the American men’s hockey team following their gold medal win in Italy on Sunday.

clusters.title: China, Germany talk up cooperation as Merz visits Beijing

items.title: China, Germany talk up cooperation as Merz visits Beijing
items.standfirst: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz met with China's leader Xi Jinping in Beijing for talks on Wednesday, during his inaugural visit to his country's largest trade partner. Both Beijing and Berlin have been talking up deeper economic cooperation in the run up to the talks. France 24's correspondent in Beijing Jan Camezind Broomby has the latest.
items.content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz met with China's leader Xi Jinping in Beijing for talks on Wednesday, during his inaugural visit to his country's largest trade partner. Both Beijing and Berlin have been talking up deeper economic cooperation in the run up to the talks. France 24's correspondent in Beijing Jan Camezind Broomby has the latest.

items.title: Germany's Merz to push for 'fair' economic competition on first visit to China
items.standfirst: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched down in China on Wednesday, beginning his inaugural visit to his country's largest trade partner and a high-tech rival as Europe's biggest economy struggles Merz said he would use the trip to push for “fair” economic competition with China.
items.content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched down in China on Wednesday, beginning his inaugural visit to his country's largest trade partner and a high-tech rival as Europe's biggest economy struggles Merz said he would use the trip to push for “fair” economic competition with China.

items.title: German chancellor lands in Beijing for inaugural China trip
items.standfirst: Friedrich Merz said it would be a mistake to "decouple" Germany from China shortly before boarding a plane to Beijing.
items.content: Friedrich Merz said it would be a mistake to "decouple" Germany from China shortly before boarding a plane to Beijing.

ai_summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits China

clusters.title: Rescuers search for missing after deadly flooding hits southeastern Brazil

items.title: Rescuers search for missing after deadly flooding hits southeastern Brazil
items.standfirst: ​At least 30 people died after heavy rains hit Brazil's southeastern state of Minas Gerais, local authorities said on Tuesday, while 39 people were missing. A river burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after the overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month.
items.content: ​At least 30 people died after heavy rains hit Brazil's southeastern state of Minas Gerais, local authorities said on Tuesday, while 39 people were missing. A river burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after the overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month.

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 30 after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...
items.content: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Sri Lanka’s former intelligence chief arrested over 2019 Easter attacks
clusters.neutral_headline: Sri Lankas Former Intelligence Chief Arrested

items.title: Sri Lanka’s former intelligence chief arrested over 2019 Easter attacks
items.standfirst: Investigators say Suresh Sallay aided and conspired in the deadly Easter Sunday attacks that killed nearly 300 people.
items.content: Investigators say Suresh Sallay aided and conspired in the deadly Easter Sunday attacks that killed nearly 300 people.

items.title: Sri Lanka arrests ex-spy chief for ‘abetting’ 2019 Easter bombings
items.standfirst: Sri Lanks authorities on Wednesday arrested the country's former intelligence chief, Suresh Sally, for "conspiracy and aiding and abetting" the 2019 Easter bombings, which killed 279 people, according to an investigating officer. A whistleblower has claimed Sallay allowed the attack to proceed with the intention of influencing the 2019 presidential election.
items.content: Sri Lanks authorities on Wednesday arrested the country's former intelligence chief, Suresh Sally, for "conspiracy and aiding and abetting" the 2019 Easter bombings, which killed 279 people, according to an investigating officer. A whistleblower has claimed Sallay allowed the attack to proceed with the intention of influencing the 2019 presidential election.

ai_summary: Former intelligence chief Suresh Sallay arrested
Sallay aided and conspired in Easter attacks
Attacks killed nearly 300 people
Sallay allowed attack to proceed for election
Whistleblower claims Sallay had prior knowledge

clusters.title: Japan to deploy missiles on island near Taiwan by 2031
clusters.neutral_headline: Japan To Deploy Missiles Near Taiwan

items.title: Japan to deploy missiles on island near Taiwan by 2031
items.standfirst: The remote Yonaguni island lies on the frontlines of self-governing Taiwan's growing tensions with China.
items.content: The remote Yonaguni island lies on the frontlines of self-governing Taiwan's growing tensions with China.

items.title: Japan to deploy missiles to island near Taiwan by 2031, says defence minister
items.standfirst: Surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni, Japan’s westernmost islandJapan will deploy missiles to a tiny island near Taiwan within five years, its defence minister has said, in a move that is likely to inflame tensions with China.The surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni – Japan’s westernmost island – by March 2031, Shinjiro Koizumi said. Continue reading...
items.content: Surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni, Japan’s westernmost islandJapan will deploy missiles to a tiny island near Taiwan within five years, its defence minister has said, in a move that is likely to inflame tensions with China.The surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni – Japan’s westernmost island – by March 2031, Shinjiro Koizumi said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Japan to deploy missiles on Yonaguni island
Missiles will be deployed by 2031

Deployment is due to tensions with China
Japan and Taiwan have growing tensions with China
